Package controller

Class ConfigurationHandler

java.lang.Object
controller.ConfigurationHandler
public class ConfigurationHandler
extends java.lang.Object
The class ConfigurationHandler handles the reading of writing of configuration information from a file. It will return a boolean response showing whether or not reading or writing were successful.
Version:
2020-12-10
Author:
Devon X. Dalrymple

    Constructors

    ConfigurationHandler()
    Default constructor for ConfigurationHandler.

    Alters the set configuration in a file if able and saves the new key value pairs.

    Getter for the configuration settings retrieved by the ConfigurationHandler

    Reads the configuration file if it exists and stores the key-value pairs

  • Constructor Details

    • ConfigurationHandler

      public ConfigurationHandler()
      Default constructor for ConfigurationHandler.

  • Method Details

    • getConfig

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> getConfig()
      Getter for the configuration settings retrieved by the ConfigurationHandler
      Returns:
      The config settings

    • readConfiguration

      public boolean readConfiguration()
      Reads the configuration file if it exists and stores the key-value pairs
      Returns:
      true if the configuration was successfully read, will also turn false if the config is left empty

    • writeConfiguration

      public boolean writeConfiguration​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> settings)
      Writes a configuration file if able and stores the given key-value pairs
      Parameters:
      settings - The key-value pairs to store as a file (No | [Vertical Pipe] or ; [Semicolon] Allowed])
      Returns:
      true if the configuration was successfully written

    • alterConfiguration

      public boolean alterConfiguration​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> settingsToChange)
      Alters the set configuration in a file if able and saves the new key value pairs. The configuration file must have a matching key in order to be altered.
      Parameters:
      settingsToChange - The values to be changed for the specified keys (No | [Vertical Pipe] or ; [Semicolon] Allowed])
      Returns:
      true if the configuration was successfully altered
